metadata.Title: CVE-2021-28905 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - low
metadata.Description:
In function lys_node_free() in libyang <= v1.0.225, it asserts that thevalue of node->module can't be NULL. But in some cases, node->module can benull, which triggers a reachable assertion (CWE-617).

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-28905` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libyang-cpp1 - 1.0.225-1.1
libyang-tools - 1.0.225-1.1
libyang1 - 1.0.225-1.1
yang-tools - 1.0.225-1.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: libyang package in esm-apps/jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.0.225-1.1').
